page.title: 07HOUSING:N.STOKE AND PARKVIEW
page.content: Regarding{housing}the area showed much variation.{North Stoke}had about 200 houses.The houses were very varied from very large houses set in their own grounds to small modern semi detached. The large old houses and cotages clustered aruond the church.A newer part away from the church contained modern houses of brick and tile with garages.Materials used in older buildin s consisted of bricks,wood ,flint and tiles,only one thatched roof seen.{Park View}represented an estate built in the 1950s.The houses were built as counc il houses.The houses are semi-detached and terraced with small gardens and no garages.Garages were built in a block away from the rest of the houses.A few bungaloes can also be found.The estate consists of 50 houses built mainly of brick
